intro: Crotalaria ukambensis, commonly known as the African spurred orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and vibrant yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its pods are elongated and contain several seeds. Crotalaria ukambensis is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas.
